intro: Allantodia deflexa, commonly known as the bent-stemmed allantodia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish or reddish and appear in late spring to early summer. Allantodia deflexa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
